data.title: Excellent All Around
data.text: Visited Saturday night 11/4/16 and was quite impressed.  The bar tenders were friendly and on point, even introducing themselves with a handshake.  We were then seated outside for our 7:30 reservation and the service continued to shine.  Adrienne?, our server, was warm and attentive without being overbearing.  We were not rushed.  While not inexpensive, the portions were large for a classy restaurant.  The Snapper and Swordfish were fabulous, as well as a salad we shared. The bread was warm and tasty.  We will definitely return on our next trip to Delray.

data.title: Over priced
data.text: Out celebrating friend birthday. There was a total of 20 and the staff could not keep up with us. I ordered the Red Snapper when my dish came out I was disappointed you could not see the Snapper. I think that they ran out of food and they were slicing our portions in half.

data.title: Always Great
data.text:
32 East isn't new to Delray, but it sings new, food is always on point and update regularly.
The wine list is excellent and the service on point.

data.title: 32 east
data.text:
Great restaurant for a special occasion.
Limited menu and great wine list. Entrees are pricey but good

data.title: Great
data.text: I've been to this restaurant 15 or 20 times over the past few years.  Consistently wonderful.  Get a sidewalk table if you want to watch the DelRay parade walk by.  I prefer the inside.  Creative food, excellent wine list.  This is the best restaurant in DelRay.

data.title: Great menu, great experience!!
data.text:
32 East is one of the standout restaurants in Delray Beach. The menu changes every day so you  can count on a new, fresh food experience every visit. 

The atmosphere is warm, casual and authentic. You will feel like you are at your favorite home restaurant from your first step in the door. 

The food was delicious and reasonably priced. The cocktails had a generous pour. Service was prompt, professional and friendly. Enjoy!

data.title: Best On Atlantic Ave
data.text:
We don't go often because the restaurant is extremely loud and noisy but the food is superb.  32 East is one of the oldest restaurant on the Avenue, been there for 20 years.

They have a daily menu featuring fresh and local items. Also, they have a very nice wine list with a lot of 1/2 bottles.

Michael was our server, very personable and extremely knowledgeable about both the food and wines. 

I started with and excellent spicy seared yellowfin tuna and my wife ordered a 1/2 of an arugula salad. For entrees, I had at Michael's suggestion, the local swordfish which melted in my mouth that came with summer vegetables and fingering potatoes

My wife ordered the small size of the Hakkaido sea scallops with sun noodles and bok choy.  Both were excellent.

I would rate it a 4 1/2 star restaurant..

data.title: Great cocktails
data.text: The martini's were great, pleasant service, made a meal of squash blossom appetizers, and a meatball pizza.

data.title: OMG!  We were just out for a drink and fell upon this gem!
data.text:
We are old school... married 40 years and stay home and have a great time..However, hubby decided to go for a ride with his favorite date and "hang out" in Delray at 730pm on a Friday night..... Duh..we weren't thinking were we?!  Everything is crowded..parking lots, restaurants, reservations only.... Then we saw a quiet looking place with a bar...We walked in and the pert hostess quickly sat us at a table in the bar area..We STILL dont know the name of the place yet...My husband complains immediately...I only want a drink..I'm not hungry.  What a treat for us! OMG!
The food is to die for!!  Creatively prepared, great presentation, tickles your palate and uses flavors in ways few places we have been to lately...
We love this place.. When we figured out where we were, I remembered reading about it.... We loved EVERYTHING!  Since the menu changes weekly but i will tell you to save room for bread pudding if its on the menu...Light. flavorful and made me leavethe restaurant happy...We worth it.

data.title: Bold Flavors Abound
data.text: If you want super service and bold flavors,but go to 32 East.  My bbq pork porterhouse steak was tender and perfectly cooked.coffer the it came with the best baked beans,and which seemed to to be made from great northern beans rather than the traditional navy beans.  My husband's scallops with asian noodle salad were ewually good.  The starter of tortilla soup was zingy with a warm spice on the finish. My starter of the brick oven roasted bacon wrapped figs was not as good as I had expected.  They were a little dry. Prices are about normal for the area. Will definitely go back.

data.title: My Favorite!
data.text: I love 32East.  They serve the most amazing, fresh, delicious food; nice wine selection; great bartenders and servers.  This is our go to place for any occasion!

data.title: Buzzing atmosphere and really good food
data.text:
It had been several years since I've been to 32 East, and Atlantic Avenue in Delray in general, and I was astonished - in a pleasant way. I've lived up and down the SoFla coast from Jupiter to South Beach, and I LOVE the vibe on Atlantic. It's not as pricey and over the top as SoBe and it's much more vibrant than Boca, palm Beach, or North Palm. Las Olas USED to be like this, but Atlantic is a far, far better destination for a fun night out now. 

As far as 32 East goes, everything about my visit was good. Good service, nice ambiance and good food, although admittedly a bit on the pricey side for the area. 

I had the tuna and my friend had the prosciutto wrapped figs as appetizers.  The tuna was absolutely fresh, but could have been s bit more flavorful for my taste. The figs were delicious.  We both had the snapper as a main course and it was great. 

Overall, I'd highly recommend Atlantic Ave in Delray as a destination and you really can't go wrong at 32 East.

data.title: One of my Favs
data.text: I had a grouper special here that was absolutely excellent. Great cocktails and great service to boot. A Delray fav for me.

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text: I have been to many local "foodie" places and most of them fade away after a few bites.  But 32 East did not fade at all.  Even though the entrees were a bit in the pricey range by local standards, $30-40, my wife and I sent back "clean" plates!  We had the Yellowfin and the Skirt Steak, and totally loved ever morsel on each plate!

data.title: Another Terrific Restaurant on Atlantic Avenue in Delray
data.text: Went to this very fine restaurant last week with my cousins who were visiting from out of town. I hadn't been to 32 East in many years. I believe it was excellent then, and now has gotten even better. The ambience was great, it was not too noisy and the food was top notch. What we enjoyed the most were the Grouper and Snapper entrees--they were well presented and delicious. The service was quite good too and we thoroughly enjoyed our dinners. My cousins were impressed and said they'll go back the next time they are in town.

data.title: Favorite Resturant in Delray
data.text:
The menu and wine list are wonderful. The staff and management are very helpful. We had my father-in-laws 80th birthday party upstairs in the private room and the staff could not have been more attentive to detail.

They are a great wine list which is fairly priced. The wine steward is very knowledgeable. 

The scallops are wonderful and every dish I have eaten has been outstanding.

data.title: Good if not great
data.text: High energy and clearly popular spot given the crowd. To the restaurant's credit, service well-paced on a very busy Friday night. Food was solid but nothing special. Fish entree was tasty and, to our delight, served appropriately hot. If a convenient destination, not a bad choice. But not one to seek out because of its fine food.

data.title: Enjoyable
data.text: I purchased a $75.00 Groupon so that it made it easier on the pocket. We both had drinks she had wine and I had vodka. They brought us bread with soft butter, fresh and tasty. Then we had a starter Prosciutto Wrapped Georgia Peaches, dainty also tasty. My Lady had the Salmon and I had the Flatiron steak both were very good. Service was good and for the most he was attentive. This was our second visit in two years, we will be back.

data.title: Unique restaurant but not very versatile
data.text: I enjoyed my meal (Grilled House Blend “Au Poivre” Burger) but had difficulty finding something on the menu that fit a low carb diet.  I asked my server if I could substitute a vegetable for the fries and go without the bun.  He had to ask the chef about the substitution and came back after 10 minutes or so with the offer to substitute with broccolini.  That was fine with me, but there is a sense that substitutions are are not taken kindly to at the restaurant.  If that is the case, I would love to see them add a low carb meal to the menu as many people are following this type of diet.  The meal was delicious.

data.title: Delray's best
data.text: This wonderful restaurant with an extensive menu is right on Atlantic avenue. The food is fabulous and the service is professional. Expensive but worth it.
